sentences.sContent: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.sCn: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.sContent: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.sCn: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.sContent: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.sCn: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

remMethod.val: sanct(神圣的)+ion→神圣之物， 原指教会的法令， 引申为“批准， 赞许”→批准

words.tran: 认可的，批准的；神圣化的
使圣洁；使神圣化；把…奉献给神；认可

trans.tranOther: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something
